data.text:
Dr John McCarthy

Born 4 Sep 1927 in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, United States

Son of [father unknown] and [mother unknown]

[sibling(s) unknown]

[spouse(s) unknown]

[children unknown]

Died 24 Oct 2011 at age 84 in Stanford, Santa Clara, California, United States

Problems/Questions

Profile last modified 19 May 2023 | Created 19 Aug 2022

This page has been accessed 514 times.

Biography

John McCarthy has Irish ancestors.

John McCarthy is Notable.

John McCarthy was an American computer scientist and cognitive scientist. He was one of the founders of the discipline of artificial intelligence. He co-authored the document that coined the term "artificial intelligence" (AI), developed the programming language family Lisp, and significantly influenced the design of the language ALGOL.

He received the Turing Award in 1971.

Son of John Patrick McCarthy and Ida Glatt. He passed away on 24 Oct 2011 in Stanford, California. His obituary "John McCarthy, computer science trailblazer, dies" was published online at SFGate.com on 31 Oct 2011 and was written by David Perlman.
